title: Is there an app that allows you to take a picture of a page or anything else with words on it, and converts it to text? - Quora

response.answer_text: What you’re asking for is a Optical Character Recognition software. There are multiple apps which can do so. iOS: CamScanner, Microsoft Office Lens, Pixter, Scanner OCR, FX Text Reader, Text Scanner-OCR, ToXSL OCR, Scan & Scribe - Phone Docs OCR, Cam ScannerBlackBerry 10: Scan to Text Pro, Scanner XTWindows 10 Mobile: Microsoft Office Lens, CamScanner, OCR [img2txt], LEADTOOLS OCRAndroid: CamScanner, Microsoft Office Lens, Text Fairy, Text Scanner (OCR)

In order to recognize and extract text characters from image, you need an OCR (optical character recognition) software. OCR is very difficult, I tested many OCR software and currently ABBYY’s OCR solution is the best in my testing. You can try their FineScanner[1] for iOS. The recognition accuracy is related to many factors, if the image is clear enough and the text is not handwritten, black text on white background, regular fonts, the accuracy could be 90% or above. But you need to purchase the in-app function to unlock the OCR function. Hope this helps! Footnotes[1] FineScanner - PDF Document Scanner App + OCR on the App Store
